title: Bargain hunters spot trick to bag 29-night holiday in Asia for less than £700
text:

Travelling around Asia is on most intrepid explorers' bucket lists, but unfortunately the dream holiday doesn't exactly come cheap.

However, eagle-eyed bargain hunters on HotUKdeals have spotted a trick that means you could bag a 28-night holiday in Asia for £650 - including both flights and stays at various hostels.

You're going to need to be savvy about it, as it includes various hostels and flights, but it means you could travel around Thailand, Malaysia and Singapore from the 11th February 2020 through to the 10th March 2020.

In fact, the full trip includes visits to Bangkok, Phuket, Phi Phi, Ao Nang, Kuala Lumpur, Langkawi, Singapore and back to Bangkok.

It's based on return flights from London Gatwick with Air China, which include checked luggage, although the budget-savvy user explained that you can find cheaper deals if you stick to hand luggage only.

There are also some Air Asia and Jetstar flights as part of the travelling.

Now, unsurprisingly, the itinerary takes quite a lot of planning as you need to book the various flights and hostels, but to give you a helping hand, user BlueSkies has revealed the full itinerary of how it can be done, including the hostels to book and the flight deals.

You can check out the full trick for bagging the deals in their guide on how to do it - of course the cheapest rates are subject to availability, and you may prefer different hostels which could mean the price varies.

When we took a look, some of the prices for the flights and hostels were already going up, but it still makes for quite a tempting deal.

(Image: Moment RF)

For example, the return flights from London Gatwick to Bangkok for those dates were available with return fares from £303.92pp (based on one person travelling) - so while it's gone up in price, it's only by an extra £10 so it still makes for a tempting bargain.

Meanwhile, the various hostels also proved to be as budget-friendly as the user claims, although in some cases the dormitory rooms had sold out - but there are plenty of alternatives where you could find similar prices.

(Image: Moment RF)

The itinerary also offers a day or two at each destination, but if you plan ahead then it's easy to make the most of the trip.

It's also worth noting that user BlueSkies looked at prices based on one adult travelling, so if you are looking for two people then prices may vary (although in some cases it could make the accommodation work out even cheaper!).
description: Bargain hunters on HotUkdeals have found a way to spend a month travelling in Asia on a budget
